attributes.title: What you didn't know about passing dynamic classname and attribute bidings from parent template
attributes.summary: The straightforward way of applying dynamic class/attribute bindings to a component is within that component's class definition. For build-in and third-party components that would require subclassing, which is often undesirable. It's tempting to pass the bindings from a parent template without subclassing, but that works not how you think it works.

attributes.title: I've joined Deveo!
attributes.summary: It's always been a dream of mine to build a product from developer for developers.

attributes.title: Do not confuse environment for deploy target
attributes.summary: Most frameworks have a concept of *environment*. Many developers are misusing it as a deploy target.

attributes.title: New website!
attributes.summary: The new personal website is live!  Though it looks humble, it's packed with Ember features and best practices. Meant to be a showcase of my skills.

attributes.title: PromiseProxyMixin: pure Ember alternative to ember-concurrency
attributes.summary: ember-concurrency is an extremely powerful and useful addon. Yet, if your only use case is fetching or sending data, there's a lighweight alternative.

attributes.title: Do return an `RSVP.hash()` from your routes' `model` hooks!
attributes.summary: It's a relatively widespread opinion that returning a hash from the `model` hook is a bad practice. I believe it's not! I always return a hash, following a witty pattern, and find it very beneficial.
